p: Tensaw virus (TENV) from Tensaw River in the southeastern United States was isolated from An. crucians and An. quadrimaculatus [ 57]. Humans, dogs, raccoons and cows were positive for TENV by serological tests, indicating that TENV was transmitted from mosquitoes to vertebrates. An. quadrimaculatus and An. albimanus remained infective from 2â€“14 d post-infection [ 57].
